page.title: 09WALTON PRISON LIVERPOOL
page.content: {Liverpool Prison}with its 1400 inmates is a secure local prison for adult men, with one wing for young men aged 15-21 sentenced to terms of{Youth {Custody}(for under 21's it is not called 'imprisonment'). It has a prison{hospital}for prisoners in the North of England and Wales who need medical and surgical treatment. The prison's area, including a sportsfield inside the walls, is 22 acres. Staff includes 400 officers, who maintain security, and direct day to day prison life, and 150 civilians whose skills and trades you would find in a small town eg. doctors, dentists, priests, plumbers, builders, electricians, and teachers. Inmates work producing goods, mostly for use within other parts of the government eg. mailbags.
